column4: Hello people!  What is the easiest way to convert VCR to digital on Ubuntu?
hire someone else to do it
does the 4gb stick work when you install it by itself?
Don't feel like trying.
well i can tell you for sure, your not allowed to mix memory like that
dual channel memory doesnt work that way
So i have to put 8 GB and that's it?  What do i do with the 2 GB + 2 GB that comes with the laptop?
the memory needs to be the same, 2, 2+2, 4, 4+4
its also possible your board doesnt support 4gb sticks, and the most you can have is 2+2
but that's not fair, another computer has 1 GB + Â½ GB of RAM DDR1.
Up to 8GB according to Crucial.
that was before dual channel architectures
not reall, use only the 4 stick for now
twice as fast
Then i'm not ahead compared to 2 GB + 2 GB i had before!
the 2+2 will be faster then the 4 alone
but you should still test the 4 works all by itself
It's brand new and sealed from the store!  Unlikely it won't work.  What do i do with the 2 GB and 2 GB i have left?  Other computers with DDR2 won't take them!  Darn, who makes RAM like this?
I suggest you mail the 2 2GB to me.
As a donation?
also, intel made memory like this
I would keep the sticks, you might obtain a craptastic used box in the future that could use them
